title: [K-12] Problem-Based Social Inquiry Project Through Blended Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social science reasoning skills and digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environment where students investigate and propose solutions to real-world social issues

learning_goals: Learners apply at least three collaborative problem-solving strategies in blended (online/offline) environments
Learners collect and analyze data related to real-world social issues using mobile devices

Learners can create a self-directed learning plan structured in three stages (problem definition → solution exploration → implementation planning) for community problem-solving projects in PBL (Problem-Based Learning), upload execution results (photos/videos/text) to a digital portfolio at least twice within a week, and achieve 'excellent' ratings in at least three of five peer evaluation rubric criteria (creativity, feasibility, collaboration, completeness, presentation skills) during the final presentation.

Learners can collaborate with three team members on Google Jamboard or Miro platforms to analyze local environmental issues (e.g., plastic waste) through a three-stage process (problem definition → idea generation → visualization), produce a 5-minute presentation (5+ slides), and deliver a presentation meeting at least 80% (4/5) of peer evaluation rubric criteria.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
